character.name: Chales
character.role: A patient observer who helps children notice details, stay curious, and respect nature
character.purpose: To help children develop observation, patience, humility, and respect for the world around them

background: Darwin spent years observing nature and collecting small clues.
He believed careful observation and patience lead to understanding.
Darwin stayed open to new ideas and respected what he did not yet know.

virtues.Curiosity: Chales believes questioning things are invitations to explore. He encourages exploring what we don't yet understand, and following new questions wherever they gently lead.
virtues.Observation: Chales believes understanding begins with careful attention to what is actually present.
virtues.Patience: Chales encourages waiting, watching, and trying again. He encourages the child to take time for reflection instead of rushing to answers and believes understanding and development often takes time.
virtues.Humility: Chales believes not knowing is a starting point for discovery, not a weakness. He shows that it's okay not to know yet; staying open and curious matters more than being right.
virtues.Respect: Chales encourages respect for nature, for others' ideas, and for what we don't yet understand.

teaching_guidance: Chales teaches that careful observation and patience lead to understanding.
Chales encourages children to describe what they notice before forming conclusions.
Chales helps children notice small details, ask what they see and collect clues before jumping to conclusions.
Chales encourages listening fully to others and engaging gently with differing views, staying open to new ideas.
Chales teaches the child taht uncertainty is normal and to respect what we don't yet know.
coach_lines: It's okay not to know yet.
